title: General Paper 4 (June 2019)
description: Final Qualifying Examination General Paper from June 2019. Contains 49 questions covering Research, Nursing Education, Management, and Clinical Nursing.

questions.question: Anonymity in research is aimed at:

options.text: Keeping names of respondents known to the research supervisor only
Ensuring protection of the source of information
Selectively disclosing information to specific individuals

questions.explanation: Anonymity means the researcher cannot link the data to the participant.

questions.question: The aim of identifying learners' needs in the process of teaching and learning is to:
questions.explanation: Addressing learner needs makes content relevant, increasing motivation.

questions.question: The sum total of all learning activities and experiences a learner undertakes in a learning institution from admission till qualifying is a:
questions.explanation: Curriculum encompasses all experiences (planned and unplanned).

questions.question: Restrictions in the study that may decrease credibility of the findings are:
questions.explanation: Limitations are weaknesses or restrictions (e.g., sample size, bias).

questions.question: Variables are best described as:

options.text: Concepts and relational statements that present view of phenomena
The abstract and theoretical bases for a study
Concepts and relational statements with a theoretical meaning
Concepts at various levels that are measured, manipulated or controlled

questions.explanation: Variables are measurable/manipulable concepts.

questions.question: An in-depth investigation in research of an individual, group, institution or phenomena is called:
questions.explanation: Case studies are detailed, in-depth investigations of a single unit.

questions.question: The main difference between experimental and non-experimental studies in research is:

options.text: The researcher manipulates the independent variable in an experimental study
The researcher is an active agent in experimental study
The researcher manipulates the dependent variable in experimental study
The researcher manipulates the dependent variable in non-experimental study

questions.explanation: Manipulation of the Independent Variable is key to experiments.

questions.question: In the treatment of diarrhoea at home as per the IMCI guidelines, the mother is advised to:

options.text: Reduce the number of times of breastfeeding to give room for ORS
Continue giving fluids until the diarrhoea stops
Stop giving fluids if the child vomits
Stop giving fluids if the child looks well hydrated

questions.explanation: Fluids should continue until diarrhea stops to prevent dehydration.

questions.question: An instructional objective is stated in terms of:
questions.explanation: Objectives must describe what the learner will do.

questions.question: The following are examples of quantitative research:
questions.explanation: Descriptive, Correlational, and Experimental are quantitative methods.

questions.question: The health message you will share with a patient who is discharged on Haloperidol 10mg orally twice daily, will be:

options.text: Take the medication 1 hour before a meal
Decrease the dosage if signs of illness decrease
Apply a sunscreen before exposure to the sun
Increase the dosage up to 50mg twice per day if signs of illness don't decrease

questions.explanation: Haloperidol causes photosensitivity.

questions.question: The goal of crisis intervention is:

options.text: To solve the clients problems for him
Psychological resolution of the immediate crisis
To establish a means of long term therapy
To provide a means for admission to an acute care facility

questions.explanation: Crisis intervention restores pre-crisis functioning (immediate resolution).

questions.question: The only effective treatment for alcoholism is:
questions.explanation: Total abstinence is required for recovery from addiction.

questions.question: The best intervention for a client having panic attack is:

options.text: Involve the client in a physical activity
Offer a distraction such as music

questions.explanation: Staying with the client provides safety and reassurance during panic.

questions.question: The overall goal of psychiatric rehabilitation is for the client to gain:
questions.explanation: Recovery involves living a meaningful life despite the illness.

questions.question: According to Sigmund Freud, the major developmental tasks at phallic stage is:

options.text: Focusing on the opposite sex relationships and learning independence
Identification with same sex parents and focusing on genital organs
Focusing on the relationships with same sex peer and sexuality repression
Oral gratification and focusing on the excretory functions

questions.explanation: Phallic stage involves resolving Oedipus complex via identification.

questions.question: Match the symptom with its definition:

pairs.right: Holding seemingly contradictory beliefs or feelings about the same person
Feeling no joy or pleasure from life or any activities

questions.explanation: Ambivalence = Mixed feelings. Anhedonia = No pleasure.

questions.question: The client who is involuntarily committed to an inpatient psychiatric unit loses the following rights:
questions.explanation: Involuntary commitment restricts freedom of movement.

questions.question: The part of personality that provides a buffer between the ID and the outside world is:
questions.explanation: The Ego mediates reality.

questions.question: The drug of choice in the management of anxiety is:
questions.explanation: Benzodiazepines (Diazepam) are anxiolytics.

questions.question: Burkitts lymphoma mainly affects:
questions.explanation: Burkitts lymphoma typically presents with jaw tumors or abdominal masses.

questions.question: Priority signs in management of paediatric emergencies are:

options.text: Small baby less than two months, convulsions, high temperature
Severe pain, signs of dehydration, convulsions

questions.explanation: Priority signs (3Ps) include Tiny baby, Temperature, Pain, Pallor, etc. Convulsions is technically an Emergency sign but often grouped in priority questions in this context.

questions.question: The percentage of burns in a child aged 2 years whose lower limbs are burnt is:
questions.explanation: Using Lund and Browder, a toddler's leg is approx 14%.

questions.question: Measles contributes to malnutrition because it causes:
questions.explanation: Mouth ulcers (pain), fever (catabolism), and diarrhea lead to malnutrition.

questions.question: An intravenous fluid suitable for treatment of severe dehydration in children is:
questions.explanation: Ringer's Lactate is preferred for resuscitation.

questions.question: An elevation of body temperature in a child with congestive cardiac failure is as a result of:

options.text: Insulating effect of edema and electrolyte imbalance
Increased heat production and respiratory acidosis
Heat dissipation as a result of diminished cardiac output
Increased interstitial fluid and muscular activity

questions.explanation: Poor perfusion (vasoconstriction) impairs heat loss.

questions.question: Clinical manifestations of meningococcal meningitis in children includes:

options.text: High fever, stiff neck, intense headache
Projectile vomiting, joint pains, blurred vision
Irritability, stiff neck, watery inflamed eyes

questions.explanation: Fever, Neck stiffness, Headache are the classic triad.

questions.question: Validity in research refers to:

options.text: The degree to which value on a set of scores are widely different or dispersed
The degree to which an instrument measures what it is intended to measure
A measure of variability or dispersion, equal to standard deviation squared
A recurring regularity emerging from analysis of qualitative data

questions.explanation: Validity is accuracy.

questions.question: Gender of subjects in a research is an example of:
questions.explanation: Gender is a categorical label (Nominal).

questions.question: The primary intention of action research is to:

options.text: Test a theory and its usefulness

questions.explanation: Action research solves practical problems in a specific setting.

questions.question: Items included in the methodology section of research are:

options.text: Problem statement, research site, research design
Sampling technique, background information literature review

questions.explanation: Methodology covers design, population, and sampling.

questions.question: Effective teaching is a function of:

options.text: Teacher making students learn and understand
Teachers liking for the job of teaching

questions.explanation: Effectiveness is measured by student learning outcomes.

questions.question: The application of operant conditioning in nursing education may be achieved by:

options.text: Stating the objectives of a teaching lesson
Using punishment to extinct negative behavior

questions.explanation: Operant conditioning uses reinforcement (rewards).

questions.question: The appropriate teaching method to a mother on the technique of breastfeeding is:
questions.explanation: Skills (techniques) require demonstration and return demo.

questions.question: As a supervisor, the best way for setting priority to meet patient's needs is:

options.text: Giving resources to the staff to deliver care
Evaluating and monitoring delivery of care

questions.explanation: Assessment is the first step in determining priorities.

questions.question: The customary way of thinking and behavior in an organization as shared by members is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Culture is the shared values and behaviors.

questions.question: A capital budget is:

options.text: To fund the routine equipment and supplies needed to operate.
For all activities of the organization for the budget period.
Manpower budget for a particular unit or cost centre.
Established to fund the purchase of major equipment or projects.

questions.explanation: Capital budget covers major, long-term assets.

questions.question: The management principle which states that work should be divided, so that each person will perform a specialized portion is:
questions.explanation: Division of labor leads to specialization.

questions.question: Goals related to organizational performance relative to factors in it's external environment are referred to as:
questions.explanation: Strategic goals relate to the long-term position in the external environment.

questions.question: Benefits of planning include:
questions.explanation: Planning reduces uncertainty and waste (duplication).

questions.question: State SIX factors that influence teaching and learning.
Outline FIVE advantages of a problem-based learning curriculum.
State FIVE benefits of stating learning outcomes in a lesson plan.
State FIVE roles of a mental health nurse in fighting social stigma.
Outline FIVE features of obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD).
State FIVE sources of research problems.
Outline FIVE signs and symptoms of a child with Cushing's syndrome.
Outline FOUR benefits of Integrated Management of Childhood Illness (IMCI) strategy.
Case Study: Masha (9yo) admitted with Acute Glomerulonephritis. Select correct signs and management.
